translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Outcaste
Thus have I heard:

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time the Blessed One was staying at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya sāvatthim piṇḍāya pāvisi
translated: Then, in the morning, the Blessed One dressed, took his bowl and robe, and went to Sāvatthī for alms.

original: Tena kho pana samayena aggikabhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa nivesane aggi pajjalito hoti āhuti paggahitā.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aggikabhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa nivesane aggi pajjalitaḥ hoti āhuti paggahitā
translated: Now on that occasion the fire was burning and the offering was being made in the brāhmaṇa Aggikabhāradvāja’s fire chamber.

original: Atha kho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ sapadānaṁ piṇḍāya caramāno yena aggikabhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā sāvatthiyam sa padānam piṇḍāya caramānaḥ yena aggikabhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then the Blessed One, wandering by stages, arrived at the brāhmaṇa Aggikabhāradvāja’s fire chamber.

original: Addasā kho aggikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ.
analyzed: addasā khalu aggikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam dūratas u vaḥ āgacchanta
translated: The brāhmaṇa Aggikabhāradvāja saw the Blessed One coming in the distance

analyzed: disvāna bhagavantam etat avoca  tatra iva muṇḍaka
translated: and said to him:🔽“Stop right there, shaveling!
Stop right there, ascetic!
Stop right there, you damned outcast!”

original: Evaṁ vutte, bhagavā aggikabhāradvājaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte bhagavān aggikabhāradvājam brāhmaṇam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the brāhmaṇa Aggikabhāradvāja:

original: “jānāsi pana tvaṁ, brāhmaṇa, vasalaṁ vā vasalakaraṇe vā dhamme”ti?
analyzed: jānāsi pana tva brāhmaṇa vasalam vā vasala karaṇe vā dhamma iti
translated: “But do you know what a low-caste person is or what the qualities of a low-caste person are?”

original: “Na khvāhaṁ, bho gotama, jānāmi vasalaṁ vā vasalakaraṇe vā dhamme;
analyzed: na khvā aha bho gotama jānāmi vasalam vā vasala karaṇe vā dhamme
translated: “I don’t know what a low-caste person is or what the qualities of a low-caste person are.

original: sādhu me bhavaṁ gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetu, yathāhaṁ jāneyyaṁ vasalaṁ vā vasalakaraṇe vā dhamme”ti.
analyzed: sādhu me bhavam gotamaḥ tathā dhammam desetu yathā aham jāneyyam vasalam vā vasala karaṇe vā dhamma iti
translated: It would be good if Master Gotama would teach me the qualities of a low-caste person.”

original: “Tena hi, brāhmaṇa, suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi brāhmaṇa suṇāhi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Well then, listen and pay careful attention, I will speak.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho aggikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho aggikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, sir,” Bhāradvāja replied.
The Buddha said this:
“The angry and malicious person,
the one who is contemptuous and evil,
the one with wrong view and deceitful,
you should know them as low-caste people.🔽The one who harms living beings,

original: Ekajaṁ vā dvijaṁ vāpi,🔽yodha pāṇaṁ vihiṁsati;
analyzed: ekajam vā dvijam vā api  yodha pāṇam vihisati
translated: whether one-footed or two-footed,
the one who has no compassion for living beings,
you should know them as low-caste people.
The one who kills and robs,
villages and towns,
the one known as a plunderer,
you should know them as low-caste people.
In the village or the wilderness,
whatever belongs to others,
Who steals what has not been given to him,
Know him to be a low person.
He who, having borrowed a debt,
Fleeing when pressed,

analyzed: na hi te iṇam atthi iti
translated: Says, “You have no claim,”
Know him to be a low person.
He who, out of desire for a little,🔽Kills a person traveling on the road,
And takes what he has,
Know him to be a low person.
He who, for his own sake or another’s sake,
Or for the sake of wealth,
When asked as a witness, speaks falsely,
Know him to be a low person.
He who, among his relatives and friends,
Looks for faults in the wives,
By force or by consent,
Know him to be a low person.
He who, having parents,
Old, past youth,
Does not support them when wealthy,
Know him to be a low person.
He who, having parents,
A brother, a sister, a mother-in-law,
Kills or reviles with speech,
Know him to be a low person.
He who, when asked about what is beneficial,
Advises what is unbeneficial,
Advises secretly,
Know him to be a low person.
He who, having done a wicked deed,
He wishes that no one would know him,
He who conceals his actions,
Know him to be a low person.
He who, having gone to another’s house,
Having eaten pure food,
Does not honour the one who has come,

original: Taṁ jaññā vasalo iti.🔽Yo brāhmaṇaṁ samaṇaṁ vā,
analyzed: tam jaññā vasalo iti  yaḥ brāhmaṇam samaṇam vā
translated: Know him to be a low person.🔽He who deceives a brahmin or ascetic,
Or any other merchant,
With false speech,
Know him to be a low person.
He who, when a brahmin or ascetic
Is present at the time of eating,
Grumbles but does not give,
Know him to be a low person.
He who speaks of what is bad,🔽Entangled by delusion,
Desiring to conquer something,
Know him to be a low person.
He who exalts himself,
And despises others,
Depressed by conceit,

original: Taṁ jaññā vasalo iti.🔽Rosako kadariyo ca,
analyzed: tam jaññā vasalo iti  rosakaḥ kadariyaḥ ca
translated: Know him to be a low person.🔽He who is angry and stingy,
Of bad wishes, selfish, deceitful,
Shameless and fearless,
Know him to be a low person.
He who reviles the Buddha,
Or his disciple,
Whether a wanderer or a householder,
Know him to be a low person.
Whoever, not being a Worthy One,
claims to be a Worthy One,

analyzed: coro sabrahmake loke  esaḥ kho vasalādhamaḥ
translated: is a thief in the world with its gods.🔽This is the worst of the low-lifes.
These are called the low-lifes,
who have been revealed by me.
One is not a low-life by birth,
nor is one a brahmin by birth.
By action one is a low-life,
by action one is a brahmin.

analyzed: tat aminā api jānātha  yathāmā idam nidassana
translated: By this you may know🔽how this is an illustration:
The son of a low-life, Sopāka,
known as Mātaṅga,
attained the highest fame,
which is difficult for Mātaṅgas to attain.🔽Many nobles and brahmins
came to attend on him.

analyzed: deva yānam abhiruyha  virajam saḥ mahā patha
translated: Ascending the divine vehicle,🔽the dust-free great path,
having extinguished sensual lust,
he went to the Brahma-world.
Birth did not prevent him
from being reborn in the Brahma-world.
Born in a family of reciters,

analyzed: brāhmaṇā manta bandhavā  te ca pāpesu kammesu
translated: brahmins related by mantras,🔽they are often seen
in evil deeds.
Blameworthy in this very life,
and in the next a bad destination,
birth does not prevent them,
for a bad destination and for blame.
Not by birth is one an outcaste,
not by birth is one a brahmin.
By one’s action one is an outcaste,
by one’s action one is a brahmin.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, aggikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte aggikabhāradvājaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the brahmin Aggikabh̄radvāj a said to the Blessed One:

“Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent, Master Gotama!🔽Master Gotama has made the Dhamma clear in many ways, as though he were turning upright what had been overthrown, revealing what was hidden, showing the way to one who is lost, or holding up a lamp in the dark for those with eyesight to see forms.🔽I go to Master Gotama for refuge and to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: May Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”
The Seventh Sutta
